name: Path T
title: Pathological T
notes:
**Note 1:**  When both the Federation Internationale de Gynecologie et d'Obstetrique (FIGO) stage and extension detail are available, record the code with extension detail in preference to a statement of FIGO stage. 

**Note 2:**FIGO Stage IVA is assigned based on tumor extension and/or regional lymph node involvement.  Code primary tumor extension based on a physician's statement of FIGO Stage IVA if it is based on primary tumor extension or the basis is unknown.

**Note 3:**  FIGO no longer includes Stage 0 (Tis) for this site.

**Note 4:**  FIGO Stage I, IA and IB are defined by size of tumor, involvement of vulva OR vulva and perineum, and depth of stromal invasion.

**Note 5:**  The depth of invasion is defined as the measurement of the tumor from the epithelial-stromal junction of the adjacent most superficial dermal papilla to the deepest point of invasion.

**Note 6:** T3 is not used by FIGO. They label it T4. If you have a record which states T4, assign T3.
rows:
Invasive cancer confined to: 
    Submucosa (stroma) (vagina)

Musculature involved

FIGO Stage I

Localized, NOS

Stated as T1

Cervix
Cul de sac (rectouterine pouch)
Paravaginal soft tissue
Rectovaginal septum
Vesicovaginal septum
Vulva

FIGO Stage II

Stated as T2

Extension to: 
   Bladder wall or bladder, NOS excluding mucosa
   Pelvic wall (described clinically as frozen pelvis)
   Rectal wall or rectum, NOS excluding mucosa

FIGO Stage III based on tumor extension

Stated as T3

Tumor invades mucosa of bladder or rectum, or 
extends beyond the true pelvis

Extension to:  
    Bladder mucosa (excluding bullous edema)
    Rectal mucosa
    Urethra

FIGO Stage IVA

Stated as T4

Unknown; extension not stated
Not documented in patient record
